laboratory_examinations.findings: Mild increase in total bilirubin level (1.28 mg/dL) and serum aminotransferase (40 U/I); slightly lower serum K concentration (3.4 mmol/L).

Severe dilatation of the right ventricle at end diastole (56 mm) and of the right atrium at end systole (74 mm, area of 43 cm2); paradoxical ventricular septal motion; TAPSE 16 mm; severe TR (vena contracta = 11 mm); left ventricular ejection fraction normal (65%); main pulmonary artery diameter 32 mm.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: At the 3-month follow-up, TAPSE improved to 12 mm with a fractional area change of 35%.

laboratory_examinations.findings: Total absence of posterior tricuspid leaflet; slight hypoplasia of anterior leaflet; normal septal leaflet.
Normal pulmonary arterial pressure of 26/6 mmHg; Qp/Qs ratio of 1.
Normally functioning prosthesis with normal transvalvular gradients (maximum/medium = 7/4 mmHg); mild (Grade I) TR; moderately impaired RV function (TAPSE 7-8 mm).
Normal functioning prosthesis; absence of peri-prosthetic regurgitation; transvalvular gradients similar to those measured immediately post-surgery.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Partial recovery of RV function was observed, with TAPSE improving to 12 mm.
